# Hyperfy Development and Features Overview

The Hyperfy Discord channels show active development and community engagement across several technical areas:

## Technical Updates
- **Video Integration**: MP4 and M3U8 streams are supported, with YouTube/Twitch integration coming via webviews
- **Streaming Options**: Vimeo Pro, Mux.com, and Livepeer were discussed as options, with HLS.js confirmed as the library for M3U8 support
- **Particle Systems**: Recently added with significant performance improvements, including collision-triggered effects
- **Chat Features**: Implementation of distance-based scaling for chat bubbles
- **Multimedia**: Successful testing of screen sharing, video (including live and 360), and voice chat features
- **Spatial Audio**: Received positive feedback for quality, with requests for room-limited audio volumes

## Installation and Troubleshooting
- A user encountered dependency issues with 'esbuild-plugin-polyfill-node' package
- Solution involved fresh clone and installation rather than updating:

git clone https://github.com/hyperfy-xyz/hyperfy.git my-world
cd my-world
nvm use
cp .env.example .env
npm install
npm run dev


## Feature Requests and Upcoming Functionality
- Hide UI elements (currently possible with Z key on PC)
- Room-limited audio volumes
- Vehicle functionality
- Potential tokenomics for moderation and land administration

## Community Projects
- "Nighthawk" project with particle system implementation
- A plugin for Eagle to help organize VRM files
- "Play world" clarified as an open canvas without content permanence

## Technical Updates and Troubleshooting

The Hyperfy development environment has seen several technical updates including distance-based scaling for chat bubbles and the addition of particle systems with significant performance improvements. Users have reported successful testing of screen sharing, video (including live and 360), and voice chat features.

Installation issues were addressed, particularly regarding dependency errors with 'esbuild-plugin-polyfill-node'. The recommended solution was a fresh clone and installation rather than an update, with specific steps provided by community members.

## Video Integration Capabilities

Hyperfy currently supports MP4 videos and M3U8 streams, with YouTube/Twitch integration coming soon via webviews. For M3U8 streaming, HLS.js is the library used. Several streaming service options were discussed including Vimeo Pro (with 2GB/month bandwidth limitations), Mux.com (described as "good and cheap"), and Livepeer.

Spatial audio implementation has received positive feedback for quality, with requests for room-limited audio volumes. Users can hide UI elements using the Z key on PC, though custom UI elements may not respond to this command.

## Community Development

Community members are actively developing tools for the ecosystem. One user mentioned developing a plugin for Eagle to help organize VRM files, which received positive acknowledgment. There was also brief discussion about AI remeshing and rebaking in relation to 3D modeling.

Feature requests included room-limited audio volumes, FLV streaming for low-latency livestreams, parkour-style movements, moderation via tokenomics, vehicle functionality, and UI improvements for better thumb usage and hiding options.
